body_html:
I believe this is happening the tensorflow binaries in PIP were built with AVX instructions, which are not supported on older or low-end CPUs.

I personally have an old model "Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU 860 @ 2.80GHz" (Lynnfield) and am experiencing the exact same problem with tensorflow 1.6. Installing 1.5 is an effective workaround for the time being.

This is discussed more in #17411, specifically this comment.
body_text:
I believe this is happening the tensorflow binaries in PIP were built with AVX instructions, which are not supported on older or low-end CPUs.
I personally have an old model "Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU         860  @ 2.80GHz" (Lynnfield) and am experiencing the exact same problem with tensorflow 1.6.  Installing 1.5 is an effective workaround for the time being.
This is discussed more in #17411, specifically this comment.
body:
I believe this is happening the tensorflow binaries in PIP were built with AVX instructions, which are not supported on older or low-end CPUs.

I personally have an old model "Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 CPU         860  @ 2.80GHz" (Lynnfield) and am experiencing the exact same problem with tensorflow 1.6.  Installing 1.5 is an effective workaround for the time being.

This is discussed more in #17411, specifically [this comment](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/17411#issuecomment-373938846).
